verses.name: Job 40:1
verses.text: Moreover the Lord answered Job, and said,

verses.name: Job 40:2
verses.text: Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.

verses.name: Job 40:3
verses.text: Then Job answered the Lord, and said,

verses.name: Job 40:4
verses.text: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.

verses.name: Job 40:5
verses.text: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.

verses.name: Job 40:6
verses.text: Then answered the Lord unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

verses.name: Job 40:7
verses.text: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

verses.name: Job 40:8
verses.text: Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?

verses.name: Job 40:9
verses.text: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?

verses.name: Job 40:10
verses.text: Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.

verses.name: Job 40:11
verses.text: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.

verses.name: Job 40:12
verses.text: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.

verses.name: Job 40:13
verses.text: Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.

verses.name: Job 40:14
verses.text: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.

verses.name: Job 40:15
verses.text: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.

verses.name: Job 40:16
verses.text: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.

verses.name: Job 40:17
verses.text: He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.

verses.name: Job 40:18
verses.text: His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.

verses.name: Job 40:19
verses.text: He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him.

verses.name: Job 40:20
verses.text: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.

verses.name: Job 40:21
verses.text: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.

verses.name: Job 40:22
verses.text: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.

verses.name: Job 40:23
verses.text: Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.

verses.name: Job 40:24
verses.text: He taketh it with his eyes: his nose pierceth through snares.
